item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Monday, October 14, 2024 at 2:50 AM UTC
item.description:
1. Starship Flight 5: Launch and booster catch [video] (1632 points | 971 comments)
2. Zero-latency SQLite storage in every Durable Object (108 points | 42 comments)
3. Refurb weekend: the Symbolics MacIvory Lisp machine I have hated (68 points | 17 comments)
4. WordPress Accessibility Team Meetings Suspended (44 points | 3 comments)
5. Making the Tibetan language a first-class citizen in the digital world (168 points | 77 comments)
6. The quiet art of attention (349 points | 108 comments)
7. Python client for the $20 Colmi R02 smart ring (7 points | 3 comments)
8. Counterintuitive Properties of High Dimensional Space (55 points | 16 comments)
9. Introducing Our New Name (92 points | 41 comments)
10. Show HN: A VSCode Extension to edit HTML visually in real-time (10 points | 9 comments)
11. Transforming Colors with Matrices (15 points | 2 comments)
12. TikTok Live Became 'A Strip Club Filled with 15-Year-Olds' (50 points | 24 comments)
13. Show HN: I built Bazaari.io to make launching online stores simple and fast (23 points | 19 comments)
14. All asteroids in Solar System, visualized (41 points | 17 comments)
15. Diffusion for World Modeling (409 points | 193 comments)
16. Christopher Columbus may have been Spanish and Jewish, documentary says (54 points | 86 comments)
17. FriendlyElec NanoPi R5S as PTP Grandmaster Clock with GNSS/GPS Discipline (2022) (13 points | 3 comments)

19. Honeybee: Calling via XMPP (4 points | discuss)
20. A novel channel contention mechanism for improving wi-fi's reliability (74 points | 27 comments)
21. Common Lisp implementation of the Forth 2012 Standard (100 points | 62 comments)
22. CRLF is obsolete and should be abolished (312 points | 184 comments)
23. Node.js, Pipes, and Disappearing Bytes (71 points | 29 comments)
24. Plop Boot Manager (17 points | 5 comments)
25. Show HN: Chain Traverser – Fast Ethereum graph explorer (46 points | 3 comments)
26. A camera in the East Village, capturing the now and the long ago (10 points | 1 comment)
27. Ward Christensen (of BBS and XMODEM fame) has died (226 points | 53 comments)
28. Llama 405B 506 tokens/second on an H200 (6 points | 2 comments)
29. DARPA is funding reef structures that will be colonized by corals and bivalves (108 points | 26 comments)
30. Design for Real Life (9 points | discuss)
